docs.title: How to build the website locally
docs.text:
1. Clone the website
  2. Make your changes and create a pull request.
  3. To build the site locally, run mkdocs serve. The website is accessible locally at http://127.0.0.1:8000/

docs.title: Installation Steps
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/your-org/your-repo.git

  2. Install dependencies: 

    pip install -r requirements.txt

Docker Required

Make sure Docker is running before proceeding with the installation.

Common Installation Issues
  • Port 8080 already in use
  • Docker daemon not running
  • Insufficient permissions

Ready to start? Head to Create a Project!

docs.title: About the Platform
docs.text: Our software platform provides robust tools for project management and process automation. This overview will help you understand the core capabilities and architecture.

docs.title: Architecture Diagram
docs.text:
graph TD
    A[Client] --> B[API Gateway]
    B --> C[Project Service]
    B --> D[Process Service]
    B --> E[Test Service]

docs.title: Key Components
docs.text:
1. Project Service: Handles project creation and management
  2. Process Service: Manages automated workflows
  3. Test Service: Handles test execution and reporting

Integration

All services communicate through a secure API Gateway. Learn more in the Installation Guide.

docs.title: Process Types
docs.text:
Our platform supports various process types:

Process Type Use Case Complexity Sequential Simple workflows Low Parallel Multiple streams Medium Conditional Decision-based High

docs.title: Creating a Process
docs.text:
1. Open your project
  2. Select "New Process"
  3. Choose a process type
  4. Configure steps

Example Process

process:
  name: Document Approval
  steps:
    - review
    - approve
    - publish

docs.title: Project Creation Guide
docs.text:
Follow these steps to create your first project:

  1. Navigate to the Projects dashboard
  2. Click "New Project"
  3. Fill in project details:
    • Name
    • Description
    • Team members

Project Templates

Use our pre-built templates to get started quickly. Access them from the "Templates" dropdown.

See Create a Process for next steps.

docs.title: Testing Framework
docs.text:
Our testing framework supports:

  • Unit Testing
  • Integration Testing
  • End-to-End Testing

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
# Run all tests
pytest

# Run specific test suite
pytest tests/unit/

Best Practices

  1. Write tests first
  2. Use meaningful names
  3. Test edge cases
Sample Test Code 
def test_project_creation():
    project = Project("Test")
    assert project.name == "Test"
    assert project.status == "Active"

See Installation Guide for setup requirements.
